Mauldin joins Holliman as All-ACC first-teamer

The University of Louisville’s added an all-ACC first-team football honor Wednesday in a vote by coaches.

Mauldin joins Holliman as All-ACC first-teamer

Jonathan Lintner, jlintner@courier-journal.com 10:41 a.m. EST December 10, 2014

U of L's Lorenzo Mauldin (94) celebrates a sack during the Cards’ game against Wake Forest this season.(Photo: David Lee Hartlage/Special to the C-J)

CONNECT 1 TWEETLINKEDINCOMMENTEMAILMORE

The University of Louisville added an All-ACC first-team football honor Wednesday in a vote by coaches.

Joining sophomore safety Gerod Holliman, a first-teamer in the media’s picks last week, was senior Lorenzo Mauldin, who switched positions from defensive end this season and went on to tally a career high in tackles (45), lead the Cardinals in tackles for loss (13) and sit second on the team in sacks (6.5).

Holliman, of course, tied the NCAA record for interceptions during the regular season with 14 and has a chance to eclipse that when U of L plays Georgia in the Belk Bowl later this month. Holliman also received ACC coaches’ votes for Player of the Year (won by Pittsburgh running back James Conner) and Defensive Player of the Year (won by Clemson defensive end Vic Beasley).

In addition to the first-team recognitions, U of L landed senior receiver DeVante Parker and senior lineman Jamon Brown on the all-ACC second team. Junior defensive tackle Sheldon Rankins and senior tight end Gerald Chrisitan were third-teamers, and senior lineman John Miller as well as junior cornerback Charles Gaines were honorable mentions.

2014 ACC Coaches’ Award Winners and All-ACC Team

Coach of the Year

Paul Johnson, Georgia Tech (10)

Jimbo Fisher, Florida State (2)

David Cutcliffe, Duke (2)

Player of the Year

James Conner, RB, So.,Pitt (6)
